name.namePart: United States District Court District of Nebraska

titleInfo.title: USA v. Torres
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER as to defendant Brigido Torres. Michael Gooch is appointed to serve standby counsel to advise and represent the defendant regarding pending motions and to take over the case should I decide to grant the motion to withdraw as defense counsel. Mr. Gooch is requested to promptly enter his appearance. The Federal Public Defender shall provide Mr. Gooch with a CJA voucher. Defense counsel, Mr. Aman, is ordered to cooperate with Mr. Gooch. A hearing on the motion to withdraw 26 and on the motion to withdraw the guilty plea 28, with sentencing to follow, if possible, is set for Tuesday, June 7, 2005 at 12:30 PM in Courtroom Number One, Lincoln, Nebraska. The defendant shall be present as shall Mr. Gooch, Mr. Aman and Ms. Wagner. The Clerk of the Court shall provide copies of this memorandum and order by CM/ECF or otherwise to Mr. Gooch, Mr. Aman, Ms. Wagner, the Federal Public Defender and the United States Marshal. Signed by Judge Richard G. Kopf on 4/27/2005. (Copy to FPD and USM) (CS, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Torres
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to Brigido Torres. It is ordered that: (1) Michael D. Gooch's motion to withdraw as standby counsel 36 is granted. (2) At the nomination of the Federal Public Defender, Jerry M. Hug is appointed to serve as standby counsel to advise and represent the defendant regarding pending motions and to take over the case should I decided to grant the motion to withdraw as defense counsel 26. (3) Mr. Hug is requested to promptly enter his appearance. (4) The Federal Public Defender shall provide Mr. Hug with a CJA voucher. (5) Defense counsel, Mr. Aman, is ordered to cooperate with Mr. Hug. (6) The hearing on the motion to withdraw 26 and on the motion to withdraw the guilty plea 28, with sentencing to follow, if possible, remains set for Tuesday, June 7, 2005, at 12:30 p.m., in Courtroom No. 1, Robert V. Denney Federal Building and United States Courthouse, Lincoln, Nebraska. The defendant shall be present, as shall be Mr. Hug, Mr. Aman and Ms. Wagner. (7) The Clerk of the Court shall provide copies of this memorandum and order by CM/ECF or otherwise to Mr. Gooch, Mr. Hug, Mr. Aman, Ms. Wagner, the Federal Public Defender and the United States Marshal. (Judge Kopf's judicial assistant provided a faxed copy to Mr. Hug and an email copy to the FPD and Marshal.) Signed by Judge Richard G. Kopf on 5/10/2005. (KLL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Torres
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to defendant Brigido Torres. It is ordered that: (1) Jerry M. Hug's request to withdraw as standby counsel is granted. (2) At the nomination of the Federal Public Defender, Michael F. Maloney is appointed to serve as standby counsel to advise and represent the defendant regarding pending motions and to take over the case should I decided to grant the motion to withdraw as defense counsel 26. (3) Mr. Maloney is requested to promptly enter his appearance. (4) The Federal Public Defender shall provide Mr. Maloney with a CJA voucher. (5) Defense counsel, Mr. Aman, is ordered to cooperate with Mr. Maloney. (6) The hearing on the motion to withdraw 26 and on the motion to withdraw the guilty plea 28, with sentencing to follow, if possible, remains set for Tuesday, June 7, 2005, at 12:30 p.m., in Courtroom No. 1, Robert V. Denney Federal Building and United States Courthouse, Lincoln, Nebraska. The defendant shall be present, as shall be Mr. Maloney, Mr. Aman and Ms. Wagner. (7) The Clerk of the Court shall provide copies of this memorandum and order by CM/ECF or otherwise to Mr. Maloney, Mr. Hug, Mr. Aman, Ms. Wagner, the Federal Public Defender and the United States Marshal. [Judge Kopf's judicial assistant provided a faxed copy to Mr. Maloney and an email copy to the FPD&Marshal.] Signed by Judge Richard G. Kopf on 5/18/2005. (KLL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Torres
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to defendant Brigido Torres. On the oral motion of stand-by counsel Mike Maloney, and with the agreement of government's counsel and John Aman, it is ordered that the hearing on the motion to withdraw 26 and on the motion to withdraw the guilty plea 28, with sentencing to follow, if possible, is rescheduled to Wednesday, June 15, 2005, at 4:30 p.m., in Courtroom No. 1, Robert V. Denney Federal Building and United States Courthouse, Lincoln, Nebraska. The defendant shall be present, as shall be Mr. Maloney, Mr. Aman and Ms. Wagner. Signed by Judge Richard G. Kopf on 6/6/2005. (KLL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Torres
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Brigido Torres (1) - Defendant pleaded guilty to Count I of the Indictment and is committed to the Bureau of Prisons for a term of 70 months, followed by 5 years supervised release with special conditions, and pay $100 Special Assessment and $1300 Restitution; Count II of the Indictment is Dismissed on the motion of the United States as to defendant Brigido Torres. Defendant remanded to the custody of the U.S. Marshal. Signed by Judge Richard G. Kopf on 6/22/2005. (5 certified copies to USM) (CS, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: JUDGMENT as to Brigido Torres (1) - Defendant pleaded guilty to Count I of the Indictment and is committed to the Bureau of Prisons for a term of 70 months, followed by 5 years supervised release with special conditions, and pay $100 Special Assessment and $1300 Restitution; Count II of the Indictment is Dismissed on the motion of the United States as to defendant Brigido Torres. Defendant remanded to the custody of the U.S. Marshal. Signed by Judge Richard G. Kopf on 6/22/2005. (5 certified copies to USM) (CS, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Torres
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER that the motion of Michael Gooch for payment, filing 48, is granted and the office of the Federal Public Defender is directed to complete the applicable vouchers for counsel to be paid in this case as soon as possible without awaiting other appointed counsel's billings as to Brigido Torres (1). Signed by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester on 1/4/2006. (Copy to FPD) (CS, )
